SEARCH
Package inf101.chess.model

Class ChessGame

java.lang.Object
inf101.chess.model.ChessGame
Direct Known Subclasses:
Chess
public abstract class ChessGame extends Object
Inspired by the Game class by Martin Vatshelle Adapted and expanded to work with chess

    • ChessGame

      public ChessGame(IChessBoard board, ChessGraphics graphics, GameState state)

  • Method Details

    • determineState

      public GameState determineState(IChessBoard inputBoard)
      Returns the current state of the game using a GameStateDeterminer.
      Parameters:
      inputBoard - the current board state
      Returns:
      a GameState (active, check, checkmate, stalemate)

    • getState

      public GameState getState()
      Returns the GameState of the game, as calculated by determineState.
      Returns:
      current state of game (ACTIVE, CHECK, CHECKMATE, STALEMATE)

    • setState

      public void setState(GameState setTo)
      Manually set the game state, useful for testing.
      Parameters:
      setTo - the GameState to set to

    • copyGameWithoutGraphics

      public ChessGame copyGameWithoutGraphics()
      Create copy of game object, but with a non working graphics object. The graphics object will be of the type ChessDummyGraphics.
      Returns:
      copy of the game with fake graphics

    • copyTo

      protected void copyTo(ChessGame target)
      This method fills in a game with the state of a given game. The method is there so the implementation of the copy method is simplified in the subclasses.
      Parameters:
      target -

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(ChessMove move)
      This method performs a move for the current player and advances to next player.
      Parameters:
      move - the move to make

    • addPlayer

      protected void addPlayer(ChessPlayer player)
      Adds a player to the game.
      Parameters:
      player - the player to add

    • isOpponent

      public boolean isOpponent(Location loc)
      Inspired by the method used in Othello, checks if the piece at the square belongs to the opposing player
      Parameters:
      loc -
      Returns:
      boolean indicating if piece belongs to opposing player

    • getGameBoard

      public IChessBoard getGameBoard()
      Gets a copy of the GameBoard.
      Returns:
      a copy

    • players

      public Iterable<ChessPlayer> players()
      Returns a copy of the current players in the game
      Returns:
      a list of ChessPlayers

    • nextPlayer

      public void nextPlayer()
      Moves the turn to the next player in the list.

    • getCurrentPlayerChar

      public char getCurrentPlayerChar()
      Gets the character of the current player.
      Returns:
      'W' or 'B' depending on if it is White or Black's turn

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public ChessPlayer getCurrentPlayer()
      Gets the ChessPlayer object of the current player
      Returns:
      a ChessPlayer (player 1 or player 2)

    • setCurrentPlayer

      public void setCurrentPlayer(ChessPlayer player)
      Sets the current player manually, used for restarts
      Parameters:
      player - the player to set to

    • copy

      public abstract ChessGame copy()
      When players are asked to make a move we don't want them to change the state of the game, so we send them a copy of the game.

    • displayBoard

      public abstract void displayBoard()
      Displays the board through the use of graphics

    • displayMessage

      public abstract void displayMessage(String message)
      Displays a message at the top of the game window through the use of graphics
      Parameters:
      message - the message to display

    • displayStartingPlayer

      public abstract void displayStartingPlayer()
      Displays the player that starts the game (the player with white) Is called at the start of the game loop

    • displayLastMove

      public abstract void displayLastMove(ChessMove move, int turn, boolean white, boolean check)
      Displays the last move of the last player to move Used in the game loop
      Parameters:
      move - the move that was made
      turn - which turn of the game we are on
      white - boolean indicating if white made the move or not
      check - whether the move came with check

    • initialize

      protected abstract void initialize()
      Sets up pieces on the board through a call to the board.

    • getGraphics

      public abstract ChessGraphics getGraphics()
      Get the graphics of the current chess game
      Returns:
      the graphics of the game

    • getName

      public abstract String getName()
      Get the name of the game (should be "Chess", but can be changed if other names are wanted)
      Returns:
      a string representing the game name

    • restart

      public abstract void restart()
      Restarts the game, reinitializes board.

    • sleep

      public abstract void sleep()
      Sleeps for the time between moves, as defined in the game.
